data.meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.
data.sentence: The word لَمْ comes from the root ل م and is associated with the meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.

data.meanings: To become lean, to diminish/decrease/waste away, to be poor, be of want or need, to perforate/pierce/skewer a  thing, to remove/transfer/shift, to pick or extract the remains of, put into the interstices of a thing, to spoil or become sour, make wine into vinegar, act as a true and sincere friend, fall short of accomplishing a task, to neglect/omit or leave undone, to absent one's self, produce bad fruit, enter/penetrate or pass through, interrupt or intervene, to be shaky/ loose/ faulty/ defective, to be uncompact/disordered/unsound, to be corrupt or disordered in temperament, to attire with an anklet or pair of anklets, to be old and worn out, to die and leave a gap/ vacancy, to be of habit/ custom, show true and sincere affection/ friendship/ love, to be flawed/imperfect/deficient, to leave one thing for another.

data.meanings: word of interjection, dispraise or threat, woe!
data.sentence: The word يَاوَيْلَتَى comes from the root و ي ل and is associated with the meanings: word of interjection, dispraise or threat, woe!

data.meanings: To give a reply which was not called for, shift, shun a question, conceal, diminish, withold, prevent.Al-Lat - female idol of the pagan Arabs, the prototype of the Greek semi-goddess Leto, one of the wives of Zeus and mother of Apollo.
data.sentence: The word لَيْتَنِي comes from the root ل ي ت and is associated with the meanings: To give a reply which was not called for, shift, shun a question, conceal, diminish, withold, prevent.Al-Lat - female idol of the pagan Arabs, the prototype of the Greek semi-goddess Leto, one of the wives of Zeus and mother of Apollo.
